Ontario Library Association (OLA), established in 1900, is the oldest continually operating library association in
Canada . With 5,265 members as of January 1, 2006, the OLA is the largest library association in Canada. OLA has six divisions covering various kinds of libraries ( public, academic, special, etc.).
OLA provides an opportunity for the people in the library field to associate, to meet, to share experience and expertise,and to create innovative solutions in a constantly changing environment. Areas of interest include networking, education, co-ordination of mutual interests and needs, lobbying and political action,information and services and products that support the work of its members.
On August 10, 2006, OLA relocated for the first time in many years to new offices at 50 Wellington Street, Suite 201, Toronto, Ontario.
